article.headline: Hereâs everything coming to HBO Max in August 2020, and whatâs leaving
article.body: HBO Max will welcome Batman in August 2020, while it says goodbye to Harry Potter. The streaming service, owned by AT&T Inc. T, -1.01% Â , will lose all eight Harry Potter movies on Aug. 25 as their licensing contract expires, but will add six Batman movies, including the 1989 Michael Keaton version and Christopher Nolanâs âThe Dark Knight.â For originals, the highlight of the month appears to be HBOâs âLovecraft Countryâ (Aug. 16), the series adaptation of the acclaimed novel about a young Black man who travels across the country in Jim Crow-era America to track down his missing father, facing terrors both human and supernatural. Jonathan Majors, Jurnee Smollett, Michael K. Williams and Courtney B. Vance star. div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } HBO Max originals include âAn American Pickleâ (Aug. 6), starring Seth Rogen as an immigrant laborer who gets pickled in 1919 and wakes up in modern-day Brooklyn; âSelena & Chefâ (date TBA), a cooking show with Selena Gomez; and the four-part documentary âRavi Patelâs Pursuit of Happinessâ (Aug 27). div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } Other August additions include HBOâs political documentary âThe Swampâ (Aug. 4), the season premiere of HBOâs NFL docuseries âHard Knocks: Los Angelesâ (Aug. 11), a new batch of Looney Tunes cartoons (Aug. 18) and movies such as âJojo Rabbitâ (Aug. 1), âBirds of Prey (And the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn)â (Aug. 18), âQueen & Slimâ (Aug. 22), and âThe Way Backâ (Aug. 29). Hereâs a full list of whatâs on tap, as of July 20 (release dates are subject to change):Whatâs coming in August Aug. 1 10,000 BC, 2008 All the Presidentâs Men, 1976 Altered States, 1980
